title: How to Use Aloe Vera Gel on Your Hair

steps.title: Transfer half of your favorite conditioner to an empty container.
steps.content: Transfer half of your favorite conditioner to an empty container. Use a spare plastic bottle or a resealable glass jar to put half of the conditioner in, and set it aside somewhere safe so you can use it later and make a second batch of aloe conditioner. [1] X Research source Mixing up a batch of aloe conditioner saves you money because it doubles the amount of time you’ll go between having to purchase new product.

steps.title: Funnel aloe vera gel into the half-empty bottle to fill it up.
steps.content: Funnel aloe vera gel into the half-empty bottle to fill it up. You may be able to simply spoon the gel in, but if the mouth of the bottle is narrow, it would be easier to use a funnel. In general, you should aim to make your conditioner bottle a mixture of 1:1 aloe to conditioner, but it’s okay if the proportions are a little bit off. [2] X Research source Use fresh aloe vera gel, which can be purchased at your local health food store, or harvest the aloe vera gel yourself if you have a plant at home.

steps.title: Shake up the bottle to fully incorporate the aloe and conditioner.
steps.content: Shake up the bottle to fully incorporate the aloe and conditioner. Reattach the lid to the bottle, and give it several good shakes until everything is mixed together. Test the product by squeezing some out into your hand—if it is primarily aloe, then you need to mix it up more. [3] X Research source Each time you use the conditioner, give it a few shakes in case either of the ingredients settled.

steps.title: Apply the conditioner after washing your hair and leave it in for 2 minutes.
steps.content: Apply the conditioner after washing your hair and leave it in for 2 minutes. After you wash your hair, apply the conditioner and let it sit for a few minutes before you rinse it out. It may take a week or two for you to notice the difference, but before long the aloe should start working its magic on your hair. [4] X Research source Aloe vera helps clear up dry skin and dandruff, and it also heals hair that has been damaged by heat or chemicals.

steps.title: Apply aloe vera gel directly to your scalp.
steps.content: Apply aloe vera gel directly to your scalp. Put 2 to 3 tablespoons (30 to 44 mL) of aloe vera gel onto your fingertips. Massage the gel into your scalp—don’t forget the back of your hair, too! [5] X Research source You can use aloe vera gel from the store, or harvest it yourself if you have an aloe plant at home.

steps.title: Leave the aloe vera gel on your scalp for 10 to 20 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the aloe vera gel on your scalp for 10 to 20 minutes. There’s no need to cover your hair with a towel or shower cap—simply set a timer and go about your business. [6] X Research source If you’re going to lay down, though, you could wrap a towel around your head to keep the aloe vera gel on your scalp, though it won’t hurt anything if it rubs off.

steps.title: Wash off the aloe vera gel with shampoo and then condition as normal.
steps.content: Wash off the aloe vera gel with shampoo and then condition as normal. After 10 to 20 minutes have passed, simply wash and condition your hair like you normally do. For extra conditioning and hair-growth benefits, use an aloe vera conditioner. [7] X Research source Avoid using high-heat instruments if you’re trying to encourage new hair growth , as it can damage your hair follicles.

steps.title: Repeat this process 2-3 times a week for the best results.
steps.content: Repeat this process 2-3 times a week for the best results. If you’re trying to encourage new hair growth, repeating this process several times a week is the best option. Make it a part of your routine at night before you go to bed. [8] X Research source Combine the scalp treatment with a once per week hair mask for shiny, smooth hair .

steps.title: Put 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 mL) of aloe vera gel into a bowl.
steps.content: Put 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 mL) of aloe vera gel into a bowl. For such a small amount of aloe, you’ll only need 2 to 3 inches (5.1 to 7.6 cm) of an aloe leaf if you’re harvesting it yourself. [9] X Research source If you don’t have fresh aloe at home, use store-bought aloe vera gel, which can be found at health food stores.

steps.title: Mix the aloe vera with 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of virgin coconut oil.
steps.content: Mix the aloe vera with 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of virgin coconut oil . For the easiest results, use coconut oil that is at room temperature—it’ll be easier and faster to incorporate with the aloe. Use a spoon to mix up the ingredients until they make a single paste. [10] X Research source If your hair needs a little extra conditioning, you could also add in 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of honey.

steps.title: Use your fingers to apply the gel to your hair, starting at mid-shaft.
steps.content: Use your fingers to apply the gel to your hair, starting at mid-shaft. Work the mask down through the ends of your hair, and then go back up and massage it into your scalp, too. Keep working the mask through your hair until it is covering everything. If you have really long hair, you may need to double the recipe. [11] X Research source Starting at mid-shaft helps ensure the mask gets smoothed over all your hair and isn’t mainly at the scalp, which could end up making it look greasy. You may need to massage the coconut oil and aloe gel with your fingers for a few minutes to warm it up and make it easier to spread. Wear an old t-shirt that you don’t mind getting a little messy, just in case any of the mask gets onto your clothes.

steps.title: Wrap your hair
steps.content: Wrap your hair in a warm, damp towel or a shower cap. This is mainly to protect your clothes and furniture while you let the mask do its work, but the warm, damp towel can help to provide your hair with a little extra moisturizing power, too, and it’ll keep the mask moist. [12] X Research source If you leave your hair unwrapped, it’s possible that the mask will start to stiffen on your hair and won’t work as well.

steps.title: Let the mask penetrate your hair for 40-45 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mask penetrate your hair for 40-45 minutes. Set a timer or turn on the TV and catch up on a few episodes of your favorite show and relax! The mask will do all the work itself. [13] X Research source Don’t leave the mask in for longer than two hours or it’ll definitely start to dry out.

steps.title: Wash your hair as normal after the time is up.
steps.content: Wash your hair as normal after the time is up. Once your timer goes off, take a shower and wash your hair to get all of the mask rinsed out. You’ll notice that your hair feels smoother than it did before. [14] X Research source No need to add conditioner after washing out the mask! Try applying this mask once per week to keep your hair nicely conditioned.
